_comment0: More info on template pools can be found here: https://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Custom_world_generation#JSON_format_8
_comment1: This is the name of the template pool itself. I tend to just put the file path and file name here with modid.
name: repurposed_structures:run_down_house/start_pool
_comment2: The template pool to refer to if the entries in 'elements' fails to generate.
_comment3: Here you can list as many nbt files or configured features to spawn.
_comment4: Do note that configured features needs a special element entry stuff.

elements._comment5: How likely out of all the element for this one to be chosen.

element._comment6: The resourcelocation of the nbt file itself of the structure piece.
element._comment7: The Jigsaw block in the structure will point to side_pool.json to spawn the other half of the house.
element._comment8: Processor JSON files can be used to randomize or replace blocks dynamically. Here, we don't do any of that.
element._comment9: If set to 'terrain_matching', the house would be deformed to fit the change in land.
element._comment10: That's best for roads so lets stay 'rigid' for now.
element._comment11: The kind of element we are spawning. This one is most likely what you want.
